content:
I'm a bit confused, backdrop-ops lists module Real Name as ported, but in backdrop-contrib there's only an empty repo which hasn't been touched in two years. Does anybody know what the actual status of realname is in Backdrop? ... and what happened to that started port?

How are we doing so far? · Issue #34 · backdrop-ops/contrib
Drupal 7.x modules list by most installed (top 125): (thought it would be nice to see what's missing - we're not doing too bad!) Key: Unported Ported In core or replaced Modules: Views (par...
backdrop-contrib/realname
Allows the administrator to choose fields from the user that will be used to add a "real name" element to a user object. - backdrop-contrib/realname

I found this https://github.com/bizmarkdev/backdrop-realname

bizmarkdev/backdrop-realname
Backdrop modules. Contribute to bizmarkdev/backdrop-realname development by creating an account on GitHub.
I don't know if this is stabile or works.
But, I do know Mark Hicks who did this port.

@StPaulTim Thanks. But that's outside backdrop-contrib, has no release and hasn't been touched since 2018, too. And possibly doesn't work - looks like abandoned after two commits. The Drupal version had update(s) in the meantime.

How do we deal with something like that?
I understand. I don't know why this is the way it is. If the @bizmarkdev version is useful, we should try to get it into contrib. But, it may not be. I just found it when I googled.

Not so hard to port, actually... https://github.com/indigoxela/realname
Fixing functional tests is still pending (weekend or so), but base functionality is there.

As there's already a repo with that name in backdrop-contrib, I "parked" it at my account. I'll move it to contrib as soon as things regarding that empty repo are clear.

indigoxela/realname
Port of Drupal 7 Real Name module to Backdrop. Contribute to indigoxela/realname development by creating an account on GitHub.

@indigoxela https://github.com/backdrop-ops/contrib mentions this:

If your project becomes Abandoned and you do not respond to an issue to grant a new maintainer within 2 weeks, your project may be modified by a Backdrop Contrib Administrator without your explicit consent, to add a new maintainer.

backdrop-ops/contrib
Apply to join the contributed code developer team. - backdrop-ops/contrib

...and I see that you already did what needs to be done: https://github.com/backdrop-contrib/realname/issues/2 :+1:

Request to delete this stub realname repo · Issue #2 · backdrop-contrib/realname
Hi @kreynen, it seems, you're not actually working on this port (anymore). Would it be OK for you to remove it? It's blocking another (functional) port from getting added to backdrop-contrib.
...there's only a master branch on that repo, so instead of deleting the entire repo, you could simply push a 1.x branch I believe. Once that's done, you could remove the master branch.

To keep the full Drupal history, it's probably easier to simply delete that stub repo and then move my repo to contrib. That stub repo has a commit, but no Drupal history.

indigoxela/realname
Port of Drupal 7 Real Name module to Backdrop. Contribute to indigoxela/realname development by creating an account on GitHub.
@indigoxela kreynen stopped all work on Backdrop about a year ago. He switched jobs and is no longer involved with Drupal either. So safe to take over that repo

Ah, OK, good to know. He still seems to do something on Github, though, so it's probably polite to wait a bit.
And then it's a permission thing - I can't delete other people's repos...
Anyway, thanks for the info.
@indigoxela when you do want the repo deleted, open an issue in backdrop-ops/contrib and someone with delete-permissions can help with that

I didn't open a new Issue, but commented on the initial one
Can someone with delete permissions have a look?

Porting Real Name module · Issue #424 · backdrop-ops/contrib
Name of the module, theme, or layout you are working on Real Name Link to the drupal.org module, theme, or layout https://www.drupal.org/project/realname There are at least two stalled attempts to ...
Alas, I don't have access. I think only @jenlampton and @klonos do...

As now the repo is in backdrop-contrib I's like to adapt the repo description. And can't, of course. I'd need to be admin of my own repo to do that. But I'm not. Where can/should I open an Issue to get that solved?

https://github.com/backdrop-ops/contrib/issues

backdrop-ops/contrib
Apply to join the contributed code developer team. - backdrop-ops/contrib
